comment: Dr. V is honestly a really great teacher, and when you take her class, you'll quickly understand that she truly cares about her students. Her class, however, is not for the faint of heart, and if you don't have a solid work ethic, you will not pass the class. Homework is heavy, attendance is mandatory, and the tests make up most of your grade.

Dr. V brings so much enthusiasm into her lectures, it actually made me excited to learn math for the first time in a while. Compared to my previous math professors, her class was a breath of fresh air. If you like group work and consistent feedback on your understanding, she's the one for you. I can't recommend her enough!

The material you learn during this course is not easy, but Dr Vandenbussche gives you everything you need to succeed in her class. I really struggle in math courses usually because math lectures are very hard to make engaging, but Dr. V succeeds in that. She explains everything so well, and also gives so much opportunity for extra credit. TAKE HER!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment:
If you don't NEED to have a strong foundation in Calc I wouldn't take her. But if you want a professor who GENUENLY cares about her students, is amazing at lecturing, and puts 110% of her effort into teaching, take her.

This class is NOT an easy A, but damn if you match the work she puts in, you will walk out this class a master in the material.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: I wouldn't recommend taking this class. I'm in a different calc 1 class now, and I have been comparing the quizzes I take in my new class to the ones I took in hers, I can confidently say her quizzes and exams are WAYYYYY harder than the ones I'm taking now. She also gives DAILY homework even on WEEKENDS. Dr. V is a nice person, tough course though
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: She's definitely not an easy professor but she gives excellent lectures. There's a lot of homework but it's basically participation grades. If you're willing to put in the work then I highly suggest her because she's great at explaining and very enthusiastic. There's also plenty of extra credit opportunities, exam retakes, and outside of class help

Exams are 75% of your grade. The average on our first exam was 65. Be prepared to have a literal daily homework schedule including weekends. There is a flawed reasoning that the mountain of *graded* homework is used to study for exams. Quizzes every Thursday, be sure to not have a job or other classes. I can't express how much I dislike her class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Dr. V's class was one of the most informative I've ever taken- She cares a lot about the students, and has bright and engaging lectures where you are always participating. A lot of people say there is too much homework, however that is the way you study for math, especially this class. If you try in class and use the extra credit, you will be fine.

Do not take this class if you only have to take Calc 1! She is a very tough grader and assigns a lot of homework. She is a very nice lady who can explain things well but her tests are significantly tougher than other professors in the Math department. The final exam, which is written by the math department was FAR EASIER than all of her tests.

Dr. V is a great professor! Although she gives you mountains of homework, it's all to prepare you for the tests in her class. She's not an easy teacher, but regardless of your grade, you'll walk away understanding more about calculus and feeling prepared for Calculus 2.

I am a transfer student to Georgia Tech and let me just say she is nowhere near a 5 difficulty y'all do'nt know all the opportunities she gives you along with the student help center. I ended calc 1 with a B due to being a bad student but after I met with Dr. V when I was worried she knew I would be just fine... BECAUSE I CARED, WE LOVE DR. V.

She will definitely prepare you for harder math classes. If you just need to take calc 1, do NOT take this class. If you really want to learn calculus and be prepared for 2 and 3, take her. Tests are brutally difficult compared to other classes, so much homework and pop quizzes. You can retake 1 test and final replaces lowest test score.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: This class features mountains of homework, lots of textbook work, pop quizzes, but the teaching of the content itself was great. Dr. V offers bright, engaging lectures and lots of outside resources. It's an extreme amount of work, but if you truly do utilize all the offered resources, you will be fine.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Assigns too much work, even before exams, there are written problems you need to do from the textbook plus online ones that are due at least three times a week. Her grade distribution overall is ludicrous, puts too much on exams, and homework or other content like quizzes is worth pretty much nothing, so you need to do really well on exams to pass.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Get ready for tons of homework due each Wednesday, all from textbook and worksheets, meanwhile having online homework due every other night. Very hard grader, and if you make one mistake or take a shortcut, she will take off a ton of points. Lots of assignments due on exam week, which takes away from study time. Laws and theorems all over exams.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: She is very passionate and attentive. She does a great job at explaining calculus concepts. She posts all her notes and is very lenient on attendance.The bad: We have to make our own study guides, homework is extremely heavy, has random pop quizzes that are incredibly easy to fail. This class will make you work and you NEED to be strong in pre calc
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: She is a very knowledgeable professor who is great at teaching. The class is pretty hard and the quizzes consist of the hardest homework problems. I would say it is pretty hard to get an A in the class unless you do really well on the quizzes. Overall, I enjoyed taking Dr. Vandenbussche's class, I would recommend her if you hard working.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Accessible outside class

comment: You can tell she is very passionate about teaching and math. Participation grade is taken with no room for being late. As well as one homework and quiz grade per week, which can be a lot. I did feel like she rushed through the lectures a little bit, also, a lot of group work.

In general, she is good professor but you should be done what she gives. A tons of homework, this class required you work super hard. She drops 3 lowest quiz, she picked some most difficult questions of your homework.

Dr. V is the best math professor I have had at KSU. She is very understanding, great at explaining things, and will do everything in her power to succeed. Be prepared for pop quizzes and lots of homework. Moreover, you need to be prepared to write a lot. All in all, she is probably the best professor you could get for Calc 2.

Failed last semester and now finishing with a high B. Mandatory attendance, lots of weekly homework, weekly quizzes, but all of that really forces you to learn the material. Tons of extra credit opportunity, lots of grades, always accessible, 10/10 engaging lectures. Professor V could genuinely be one of the best professors at KSU. Take her

Dr. V was an AWESOME professor. She takes a lot of homework for a grade, but part of the homework grade helps increase your test scores. There are many opportunities for extra help, and she is quick to respond if you email her outside of these opportunities. She is a very tough grader though, but also very clear with her expectations.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Professor V. is amazing. She takes time to explain things and she's clearly passionate about what she does. The workload is a lot, and she is a tough grader. If you work hard, you will get good grades. Take her!

Dr. V is an amazing teacher. She is homework heavy and homework is graded. However, these homework grades pad your grade from tests. She also allows you to retake one exam and you can use your final exam grade to replace your lowest test score. She has a great teaching style and makes sure everyone in the classroom is understanding the material!

Phenomenal experience! This is the hardest I've ever worked for a class, it'll push you past your academic limit, but if you give it your all (Use most resources!) and approach this class with a positive attitude, you can win! Also HUGE ADVICE: GO TO HER OFFICE HOURS EVERYTIME YOU CAN!  This can quickly polish your Calc skills with high efficiency!

One of the best math professors at this university hands down. Tried to be as clear in her expectations as possible and was very willing to help all students. Class time was short so she would encourage people with questions to come to office hours, boot camps, and SI sessions. That being said, she assigns TONS OF HOMEWORK. Be prepared for that...

If you don't love math, don't take her. If you do, there's no better choice. She makes you practice a ton and there's so much work, but it makes you really learn the material. She brings personality to the classroom and makes her lectures memorable every week, and her handwriting is fantastic. Her class is very difficult but so worth it.

Calc II is a hard course, and Dr. V is one of the better professors, but it was still hard to pull a good grade. Content moves fast, and there is little practice in class. Homework is graded for completion but is necessary to get enough practice. Highly recommend SI sessions and studying early. Overall high workload, especially around tests.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Dr. V is a great professor. She teaches well and her lectures  are well planned and thought through. It is a hard class no doubt, however USE the resources she gives you and you will pass.

I had Dr. V for calc 2 over summer of 2021 online. For all of the classes I took online, hers was the best. Everything was more about showing why you got your answer than what your answer was. Shes a harsh grader for silly math mistakes, but she really forces you to learn. If you want to really learn the content, take this prof. Itll be hard :b
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: If youre bad at math/trying calc 1 w/ weak pre-req knowledge shes your best chance at learning. If attempting with no pre-req at all TAKE PRE-CALC, you wont be able to keep up w/ the DAILY hw and weekly quizzes even tho she includes a unit on pre-calc. Strong pre-req: best calc ever. I failed but she was the best teacher I've ever had. dont be late
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: I had Dr. V for Calc I and she's a great teachershe genuinely cares. I feel like if the class was held more often, it would be infinitely easier; It is VERY homework-heavy (hint: the in-class quizzes are taken straight from the homework!) and if you're an architecture major like me, you need to balance your time between this class and studio.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: DO NOT take this professor unless you love writing essays. You'll never be able to give a straight answer without having to turn into Shakespeare to explain yourself. Even on simple assignments like exit tickets, she will find a way to munch away at your grade. Although her teaching and explanation skills are good, they are not exclusive to her. SA

Unless ur a math major, don't take her. She is overly conceptual for calculus. On assessments there's NEVER straight math problems, she always wants you to do random stuff like "explain why this is the best approach" on EXAMS. There are way too many assessments and she claims that they're for our own good when they aren't. She's nice on surface.

She is a wonderful teacher of the intricacies of calculus and can explain how things link together unlike many other professors. Always answers questions and makes sure people understand the material. Available nearly round the clock and will help out on the smallest things. Taken online, but would take it in person too. Take her if you can!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: She is really helpful. She replies within a few minutes. She also posts a lot of help videos. There are a lot of exams 4 in class 4 extended time and then finals as well but they are not that hard and only count for a small percentage of your grade. There is one quiz and my math lab homework each week.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: All she does is give homework. Her lectures are the most useless waste of time that she requires attendance for. Instead of teaching she will put you in groups to do work, then will not even explain the problem but instead posts a video for you to watch outside of class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Dr. V is the BEST professor you could take for discrete math. DM is a weed-out class so it is difficult in general, but she definitely took the load off! Nothing in her class is LockDown Browser and every assignment is open note/Internet (you just can't use Chegg). Make sure you attend SI, her office hours, and go to class every day!

She is a national treasure! She truly cares about this subject, so she wants all her students to ask questions and seek help to understand the material. Extremely engaging! Lots of hw, quizzes, and 3 exams. Its a tough class, so it'll get frustrating, but you won't regret taking it with her!

Very caring teacher. Discrete Mathematics is not an easy subject no matter who you take it with, but she make sure you understand the lesson before moving on. SI sections are also good if you need more help. Homework takes a lot of time to complete. Quizzes and exams are open book.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Professor Vandenbussche was amazing. She clearly states whats due when it is due and how much everything counts for. This class was made difficult by Covid-19 I believe if it were in person I would have done a lot better. This was her first time online and she did change things to help us throughout the semester. She is an amazing teacher.

Ms. Vandenbussche is single handedly the best teacher I have had at KSU. Discrete Math is definitely a difficult class, and I have had to dedicate more time to this class than my other 3 combined, but she gives you all the hope and help a student could ever ask for. Open note on most things, free points, and drops the lowest grades in each category

She's very knowledgeable, and her lectures are interesting and engaging. I really understood the material the way she taught it, and it was a solid challenge. You can tell she cares a lot about teaching. Going to class and doing a weekly homework assignment are required.

Dr. V is awesome! She presents the material in an easy-to-understand format. The class was really heavy on homework and quizzes, but it was all for your benefit! She's super helpful inside and outside of class, and she was easy to reach, would made COVID-19 mandatory online learning easier. Do the work, ask for help, and you'll be fine.

Dr. Vandenbussche is without a doubt the best professor I've ever had. While the class is hard it never felt as if it was needlessly hard and I was constantly learning new and interesting things. She is incredibly caring and is clearly interested in the success of her students. There's a lot of homework but it always serves as valuable practice.

Please go to her office hours!! She helps you think through the problems while also still allowing you to solve it yourself. She really wants to help you and wants you to understand the material, however be prepared to put in a ton of effort. I would tell anyone really wanting to get a good understanding of logic/proofs to take her!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: if you like math and actually want to learn, taker her. if you don't and want to go easy, find different prof.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She gives good lectures & offers help outside class but thats about it. If you want to pass, you have to go out of your way like we dont have other classes to worry about. Tests & homework questions are too much for a 50 minute class. She makes you create your own studyguide when preparing for tests in her guidelines which isnt helpful.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--So many papers

comment: I took Dr. Vandenbussche for both Calc I and II and she really cares about how you do in the class. She gives you homework every day and checks it in class, not online. She makes sure you know the prerequisite material that other professors may not have taught. She gives you every opportunity to succeed, you just need to take advantage of it.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Dr. Vandenbussche is definitely one of the best professors at KSU. There was a lot of homework but it was manageable if you kept up with it day to day. If you do as she instructs you will do well. Calculus 2 is a hard class and she definitely tests you to the highest standard but she's great at teaching the material and provides TONS extra of help.
NO calculators on exams or anything. So many in class worksheets, and homework to do. Good freaking luck

First week of class and she gave us all exams on precalculus. Class avg 30%. 2-3 weeks later, exam 2 involving precalc & some calc1, 40% class avg. Nice lady, but if you talk to her, she'll just say "ahh high school" and tell you to retake precalculus. Horrible.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I won't be the first to say it - you need to be prepared to put in work if you're taking Vandenbussche. Though, just like taking cold medicine, it's for the best. She gives weekly homework schedule (from the book - no Webassign!) and at least one quiz over prior material a week. It'll be tough. If you come in with the right mindset you'll succeed.

Instead of using class time to learn, classes are spent doing worksheets. If you actively participate in the work force DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS, she gives busy work. Classes before exams are squandered working on unusable study guides with peers, rather than reviewing material. There is no working ahead, problems must be worked out her way or no way
She knows her subject very well and pushes her students to be a master in it. This is important because she is teaching future engineers.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: I will give her that she was an excellent teacher. she was very clear in her lectures and easy to follow. However, She gave hard tests, didn't allow calculators, and was not good at explaining further if you were having trouble understanding. It got to the point where I was happy to make above a 50 on a test. good lecture, terrible class overall.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: She lays it all out on the table on the first day. Yes, there's a lot of homework. She posts a weekly schedule on Sunday/Monday that has all the homework and when it's due. It may seem like a lot, but it is going to help you more than anything! It's worth doing. Also, be on time or you wont get your homework graded.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: She expects you to do a minimum of two hours of homework a day including on the holidays. If you don't attend office hours you won't do well so schedule office hours on top of class and two hours of homework. And do things exactly how she tells you. Answers will be marked wrong if you don't write specific things only she requires, good luck
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Professor Vandenbussche teaches one of the more difficult classes I have taken (Calculus I), but as an engineering major having a solid foundation is important. If you opt to take Calc with her, you will learn this subject very well. If not, you are not going to pass. Be prepared to spend a lot of time outside of class working, but it is worth it.
rating_tags: Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Dr. Vandenbussche is wonderful. She really helped me get through the class when I didn't have the prerequisite skills I should have. She is seemingly always available both online and in frequent office hours. I have never had a teacher put forth as much effort as Dr. V, hands down.   Also, she's funny, which is nice.

Dr. V really does care about her students and it shows in her teaching. She offers tons of office hours to help if you need it. You are graded for homework and participation which is nice for a math class if you're not too great on the tests or quizzes. Absolutely take her class if you get the chance; she's the best math teacher I've ever had.

Mrs. V is AMAZING!!! I've never struggled with math until Calculus. I went to her when I was considering dropping the class; she gave me the tools and said aim for a B. I am at a B! DO THE HOMEWORK not just for the grade it's there to strengthen the teaching. You always get a practice test, review sheet, in/out class review. ALWAYS TALK TO HER
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: She is very kind, but her class is tough. Homework is extensive and required. She is a great teacher that is very accessible outside of class. She does everything in her power to give you all of the resources you need to succeed, but she does not make it easy.

The worst professor I had so far. Good at teaching and very helpful but when it comes to grading she is very though. If you do not put it like she wants it she will give you a zero. Even if you are correct. Mrs. Vandenbussche we are students not robots. Might as well bring a robot and put it on a chair so he can copy and paste what you want him to

She's awesome! Best professor for discrete! She really cares for her students beyond the classroom. Go to her office hours if you need help with something, she will give you maximum clarity. Practice tests are similar to the tests. Put some time into this class and you will do well.

Dr. V has to be the best teacher you could take for Calc II. She is tough with the grading on minute details but her lectures are clear which is important because she explains the material very well which is important in Calc II. HW is graded and is used to drop lowest test. If I were you, I would not skip class.

She is likely the best professor you could have for calc II. She is incredibly passionate about the material and cares about how well you understand it. She explains everything straightforwardly and includes many example problems.

She's an awesome teacher and loves to help her students and make sure they pass. Her office hours are available to you so make sure you go it is extremely helpful!  Make sure you do all the homework assignments when they are do because sometimes she can give extra credit if you're lucky. The tests are difficult so make sure you study.
Great teacher!! Very clear and willing to help. Will give homework for better understanding. Honestly if i fail it's more me being a bad student.

She gives a pretty big number of pop quizzes, but drops the lowest three. Material for the test is pretty clear, and she gives a handout with practice questions before every test. I ended with a pretty easy A, but you do have to work the problems. That's just the nature of the course.  Oh, and she's pretty hot as well.

Dr. V is a fantastic teacher. She's the first math teacher in my entire life who I've ever liked. She gives great lectures and is really funny. My only complaint is the amount of pop quizzes. Just keep up with your studying and you should be fine. She even drops the 3 lowest quiz grades! Tests aren't easy but I made a solid B with minimal studying.
Great professor! Very nice and funny. She is always available for help, and always makes jokes. I would definitely take again.
This professor grades extremely tough on minute details. The homework was online and the program messed up a lot. You also have group projects in this class, which is extremely weird for Calculus.

She's great at communicating the material clearly and effectively. She will answer any questions, no matter how rudimentary, without making you feel dumb. She offers plenty of office hours and is very helpful with any hw or math questions that you may have. Tests are easy if you do the hw and show up to class for the quizzes.  I HIGHLY RECOMMEND )

She is super helpful, and very energetic. This can be really nice, but sometimes she is way too hyped. She doesn't like being late to her class, and doesn't take hw if you are late. Otherwise, she is very clear about her lectures and tests are okay.

She is an absolutely amazing teacher!  She makes calculus seem easy, and it's not because she has easy tests, but because she explains the material well.  She is also very willing to help.  Highly recommend.  You will come out of her class a lot smarter!

Incredibly helpful teacher who wants you to succeed through Calculus 2! She has daily OPTIONAL homework which will help earn extra credit. She has a weekly schedule which she follows to the T. Recommend taking this teacher for ANY math!

Excellent teacher!  In fact my favorite teacher I've had so far at SPSU.  She explains calculus very well, and is extremely helpful.  She wants you to learn.  I had some struggles with calculus before her class, but I now feel I couldn't understand Calc I any better.  I can't recommend her class highly enough.

This was her first time teaching Intro to Prob. and Stats; however, she did an excellent job. One of the best professors I've ever had in my entire academic life. There is a lot of homework as well as quizzes; however, you do those and you'll guarantee to pass.

This women really really wants you to understand calculus in order to pass her class. Very limited calculator use on exams. Grade consist of three highest exam grades and a final. Homework counts as up to 10 extra credit points on each test. Do the homework, learn a good amount of the material and you'll be ok. Oh, she talks and writes very fast.

She has a great attitude and lots of energy!  Her explanation of material is very clear. Calc II is not an easy class no matter who teaches, but she has lots of office hours and is very willing to help.
Great teacher!  Always willing to help!  Would love to take her again.  Wish she  taught calc.2  and diff. eq. She makes the boring stuff...not so boring...

Great professor, very enthusiastic about math.  Fast talker, so pay attention.  She is very helpful and has many office hours.  She uses homework points instead of a curves for the exams, so do your homework!

She's a sweet person and willing to spend extra one-on-one time if you need help. The class got really boring after a few weeks. Only bad thing is that she talks really fast. It's really hard to get an A for her class. Exams was much harder then the Homework ! Buy the book.. she uses it ALOT.
she is amazing! goes over the top to help you. if you study, you will get an A. she loves math and it makes the class more enjoyable.
Very helpful! would take her again! she will help you until you completely understand. You must put in the effort to get an A.

She is a teacher who likes what she does for a change. She comes to class with a good attitude and is always willing to help you. She also gives extra credit assignments that will help boost your grade. All and all she is a great techer and made math a little more interesting.
She is very easy. you should take her class, if you want to get a A grade.
